header.title: An Advanced Guide To Enochian Magick

central_thesis: This manual serves as a comprehensive guide to Enochian Magick, providing the necessary theoretical foundation and practical exercises for serious practitioners to achieve self-initiation, spiritual development, and conscious control over their reality. It details the exploration and mastery of the Aethyrs and Watchtowers, aiming for the ultimate union of microcosm and macrocosm and the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel.

structure_content.chapter_title: PREFACE; AN INTRODUCTION TO THIS MANUAL
structure_content.summary: Introduces Enochian Magick by contextualizing its historical development through Dr. John Dee, Edward Kelly, the Golden Dawn, and Aleister Crowley. It positions the book as an advanced companion to 'Enochian Magic: A Practical Manual', emphasizing self-initiation and the system's depth.

Distinguishes 'Magic' from Aleister Crowley's specific spelling 'Magick' (with a 'k'), defining the latter as 'the science and art of causing change to occur in conformity with will.' It notes Magick's often sexual element in Crowley's work and stresses the need for practical application.

Outlines the manual's five main parts (general theory, invocations, Watchtowers, formulas, Aethyrs) and advises practitioners to select sections based on individual appeal, with the exception of Aethyrs which must be approached serially from TEX (lowest) to LIL (highest). Prerequisite reading of 'Enochian Magic' is assumed.

Explores the concept of the Holy Guardian Angel (HGA) as one's spiritual self, the central work of Magicians. It details the HGA's role as a guide through the Aethyrs, particularly ZID (8th Aethyr), and emphasizes developing an intuitive connection as a prerequisite for crossing the Abyss (10th Aethyr, ZAX).

States the ultimate objective: uniting the microcosm with the macrocosm and gaining conscious control over one's life. These goals are achieved by experiencing the thirty Aethyrs and invoking the HGA, with lesser rituals serving to purify and strengthen the self for the 'Ultimate Ritual' or Great Work.

structure_content.chapter_title: OUR WORLD ACCORDING TO ENOCHIAN MAGICK
structure_content.summary: Describes the seven cosmic planes (physical, etheric, astral, mental, spiritual, divine) as concentric, interpenetrating spheres, not separate levels. It explains how each plane has subplanes based on the Hermetic axiom 'as above so below' and compares them to the Qabalistic Four Worlds.

Presents man as a microcosm of the macrocosmic world, possessing a body corresponding to each cosmic plane (physical, etheric, astral, mental, spiritual). It introduces man's monadic nature above LIL and dualistic nature below, with the 'aura' being a personal replica of the magical universe, centered by Hadit and circumscribed by Nuit.

Defines the cosmic elements (Earth, Water, Air, Fire, Spirit) as quantifiers of density, not chemical substances, ranging from physical matter (grossest) to spirit (least dense). It provides three symbolic representations: magical, Kerubic astrological sigils, and Eastern Tattwas.

Views the Magical Universe as the macrocosm, where individual experiences of Watchtowers and Aethyrs vary, guided by 'signposts.' It defines the universe as a monad, with consciousness as an infinitely small point (Hadit) and the universe as an infinite circumference (Nuit), emphasizing the magician's ability to control dreams and external events by understanding this unity.

Explains the Enochian alphabet as a true language with specific magical meanings and gematria. It details how individual letter values combine to form Words of Power, and presents four gematria schemes (Aurum Solis, Golden Dawn Greek/Hebrew, Golden Dawn-Geomancy, Crowley's 'The Vision and The Voice') for experimentation.

Presents the theorem 'Every man and every woman is a star,' interpreting it as inherent completeness and self-sufficiency, guiding the realization of one's 'True Will.' This is linked to Aleister Crowley's 'Do What Thou Wilt,' which when referring to the spirit, aligns with natural law and self-expression.

Proposes that 'man is capable of being and/or using, anything that he encounters,' linking this to the Hermetic axiom 'as above so below' and the microcosm/macrocosm. It suggests that deities and demons encountered in Enochian Magick are internal projections controllable through understanding esoteric correspondences.

Outlines three core magical operations: Invocation/Evocation (bringing deities/demons into materialization/physical embodiment), Out of Body Traveling (Spirit Vision or astral traveling through subtle planes), and Skrying (focusing consciousness on subtle planes using a shewstone or other device while retaining physical awareness).

Describes the four Great Watchtowers and the Tablet of Union as representations of inner planes, connected by a Black Cross. Each Watchtower is composed of 12x13 squares, totaling 675 squares (644 importara). The physical drawings are crude representations of multi-dimensional realities, mapping forces, deities, astrological signs, and Tarot cards.

Introduces the Tablet of Union as a smaller tablet associated with the element of Ether or Spirit, designed to unite and bind the four elemental Tablets. It explains how the names of the four Cosmic Elements (EXARP, HKOMA, NANTA, BITOM) are spelled out twice within the Black Cross, forming the 20-square Tablet of Union.

Details the derivation of the four Secret Holy Names of Divinity (OROIBAHAOZPI, MPHARSLGAIOL, MORDIALHKTGA, OIPTEAAPDOKE) and the four Great Kings (BATAIVAH, RAAGIOSL, IKZHIKAL, EDLPRNAA) from the Great Crosses of the Watchtowers. It emphasizes their importance in Enochian Magick and proper recitation.

Connects Enochian concepts to Qabalistic Sephiroth. It discusses the names of presiding deities of the sixteen Sephirothic Crosses and explains the phrase ONDO-APIZE-BABALON ('eternal regions of BABALON'), linking its gematric value (318) to healing and well-being in Enochian Magick.

Illustrates the major forces (chaotic, formative, emotional, cohesive, creative, destructive, transforming) and astrological signs associated with the sixteen subquadrants of the Watchtowers. It encourages intuitive study to understand how these creative, destructive, masculine, and feminine energies flow through the system.

Explains the process of converting Watchtower Squares into truncated pyramids for visualization during skrying. These pyramids help in understanding the cosmic element combinations within each square (e.g., O in NAKO as two parts Air, one Earth, one Water), and symbolize the magical universe and the practitioner's journey to the HGA.

Describes the Great Crosses as crucial components of each Angelic Tablet, comprising 36 squares with specific vertical ('Linea Dei Patris Filiique') and horizontal ('Linea Spiritus Sancti') lines. It introduces the magical words OM-EL-OM-IA ('highest understanding is the understanding of truth') and LAHALASA ('supreme treasure zones') derived from these crosses.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE EFFECTS OF MULTIPLE LETTERS IN A SQUARE
structure_content.summary: Explores how squares with multiple letters (two, three, or four) in Watchtowers signify a variety of forces. Examples like ALMSA/ATMSA and YVSX/LVSX/NVSX/HVSX demonstrate how different letters or gematric values reveal various aspects and governing forces within a square, often linked to Egyptian deities and astrological influences.

Details the appropriate symbolic colors for the cosmic elements (Air=yellow, Water=blue, Earth=black, Fire=red) and their sub-elements, as well as for the Great Crosses based on astrological signs. It also provides specific color schemes for Sephirothic and Kerubic Squares/pyramid sides.

structure_content.chapter_title: NAMES OF ARCHANGELS, ANGELS, AND DEMONS
structure_content.summary: Illustrates the hierarchy of major deities in Watchtower subquadrants, including Kerubic Angels and Archangels (e.g., ERZLA governing RZLA). It notes the absence of demons or lesser Angels in upper squares (above Sephirothic Cross bars) and provides examples for Air of Air.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE MAJOR MAGICAL INSTRUMENTS AND WEAPONS
structure_content.summary: Defines the symbolic and practical roles of key magical instruments: The Temple (magician's universe), The Circle (limits of operations, monadic nature), The Altar (foundation, fixed will), The Wand (Magical Will, Fire, masculine), The Cup (magical understanding, Water, feminine), The Sword (reason, Air, destructive), The Pantacle (body, Earth, feminine), and The Dagger (piercing thought, Air, quicker than Sword).

Describes the two main types of magical robes: black (concealment, protection, withdrawal from everyday life) and white (aura, Body of Light, shining, elastic, impenetrable). The choice of robe depends on the nature of the specific magical operation.

Provides the Enochian words, their pronunciations, and gematric values for the Sword (NAZPS, 81/75), Cup (TALHO, 54/48), Wand/Rod (KAB, 311), Circle (KOMSELHA, 452), and Robe (MABZA, 116/110), along with their Enochian script.

Explains the construction and consecration of a Magick Circle for Watchtower operations, noting that it represents the four Watchtowers. It provides details on facing directions for elemental Watchtowers, using colors (red BITOM for Fire, black NANTA for Earth, blue HKOMA for Water, yellow EXARP for Air), and embellishments like lamps, incense, deity names, and formulas. Emphasizes psychic simulation if physical construction is not possible.

Highlights the importance of speaking and vibrating Enochian Names of Power (Barbarous Names) aloud to exalt consciousness and establish occult links with deities. It provides a detailed 6-step procedure for vibrating names, emphasizing deep breathing, visualization, and projection into the Magical Universe until 'ten thousand thunders' resound.

Details how Egyptian deities preside over the Lesser Watchtower Squares. It provides a table of deities (Osiris, Isis, Nephthys, Horus, Ur-Heru, Harpocrates, Hathor, Sothis, Apis, Anubis, Bast, Mestha, Hapi, Tuamautef, Qebhsennuf) with their attributes, roles, and connections to the Horus pantheon. Includes speech translations from the Book of the Dead related to some deities.

Explains astrological influences on the Great Crosses and Lesser Watchtower Squares. It defines the primary meanings and principles of each zodiac sign: Aries (First Cause), Taurus (Pure Substance), Gemini (Motion), Cancer (Universal Womb), Leo (Creation Manifest), Virgo (Organized Matter), Libra (Ideal Relationships), Scorpio (Emotional Power), Sagittarius (Aspiration), Capricorn (Crystallization), Aquarius (Universal Brotherhood), Pisces (Universal Solvent).

Describes planetary influences on the four Great Crosses and Calvary Crosses. It defines the primary meanings of planets: Sun (Will power, vitality, creativity), Moon (Instinct, habit, personality), Mercury (Communication, intelligence, reason), Venus (Love, beauty, harmony), Mars (Passion, desire, energy), Jupiter (Higher mind, wisdom, optimism), Saturn (Satan, contraction, crystallization, ambition).

Outlines three essential preparations for practicing Enochian Magick: assuming a Magical Name (reflecting magical goals), taking a Magical Oath (sincere commitment, e.g., the Oath of the Abyss), and maintaining a Magical Diary (systematic record of progress, psychic experiences, and dream content) to track growth and refine practice.

Emphasizes the importance of developing the 'Body of Light' (astral body) for Spirit Vision travel to Watchtowers and Aethyrs. It provides a 7-step beginner's exercise to mentally leave the physical body, transfer consciousness, move, rise, and return, stressing practice, consciousness retention, and careful record-keeping in the Magical Diary.

Differentiates invocation ('call in' to assume identity) from evocation ('call forth' to communicate while retaining identity). Explains the use of a circle to protect the magician during invocation (attracting deity into microcosm) and a triangle for evocation (attracting deity into macrocosm), along with corresponding tools (Cup for invocation, Sword for evocation).

Describes three methods for invoking a deity: Devotion (heart-based, slow, safe, akin to Bhakti Yoga), Ceremony (mind-based, direct, structured with signposts from 'Enochian Magic'), and Drama (combined heart, body, mind, assuming god-forms and enacting incidents, less usable for Enochian deities due to limited knowledge).

Outlines the four essential stages of a successful invocation aimed at temporary identification with a deity: The Form (study and assume deity's symbolic form), The Voice (hear and align with deity's characteristic utterance), The Assertion (declare identity with the deity), and The Identity (become the deity's vehicle, stating the invocation's objective).

Emphasizes that successful invocation/evocation requires elevating the mind, using the Body of Light for perception, and imagination to visualize the deity. It stresses the importance of banishing the deity after the operation to prevent harmful psycho-magnetic links and identifies the Holy Guardian Angel invocation as the most critical.

Presents a step-by-step ritual adapted from the Golden Dawn's 'Formula of Opening by Watchtower.' It involves banishing rituals, entering the Body of Light, facing elemental Watchtowers (Fire, Water, Air, Earth) while holding specific tools, tracing elemental Pentagrams and Enochian letters, reciting Calls, and vibrating Holy Names to invoke Watchtower Angels.

Defines talismans as magical figures charged with energy for specific purposes, emphasizing exact symbolism and harmony with universal forces. It discusses how talismans are charged through psychic channeling, becoming powerful personal instruments, and lists elemental correspondences for astrological signs and Tarot tools.

Explains the method of creating sigils for Watchtower deities using the 'Rose of Letters,' adapted from the Golden Dawn's Rose Cross Lamen. It describes the symbolism of the Rose (cosmic elements, planets, pentagram/hexagram) and how to trace sigils from deity names, starting with a small circle and ending with a dash.

Describes the five-pointed pentagram as a symbol of man's will and the five cosmic elements of the Watchtowers. It provides diagrams and instructions for tracing invoking and banishing pentagrams for Earth, Water, Air, Fire, and Spirit, emphasizing proper visualization of flaming, colored pentagrams in the air.

A 10-step Enochian adaptation of the Golden Dawn's Lesser Ritual of the Pentagram for banishing or invoking. It involves touching forehead and body parts while speaking Enochian words (ZAH, ONDOH, MIH, BUZD, PAID) and tracing colored elemental pentagrams (yellow Air, red Fire, blue Water, black Earth) for the Watchtowers, culminating in a call to the Four Great Kings.

Explains the hexagram as a powerful symbol of the Macrocosm and Microcosm, representing the operation of the Seven Planets. It provides diagrams for tracing invoking and banishing hexagrams for Fire, Earth, Air, and Water, detailing the starting points and directions for each triangle.

A 6-step Enochian adaptation of the Golden Dawn's Lesser Ritual of the Hexagram for banishing or invoking. It involves standing with feet together, tracing colored elemental hexagrams for Air, Fire, Water, and Earth while speaking Enochian formulas (IVITDT, ZTZTZT) and vibrating letters, culminating in an invocation of the four Holy Names of Divinity.

A 6-step ritual to consecrate a magical Wand. It involves consecrating a circle, holding the Wand, facing the Watchtower of Fire, and invoking the King (EDLPRNAA) and Seniors of Fire (AAETPIO, ADAEOET, ALNKVOD, AAPDOKE, ANODOIN, ARINNAP). This bestows qualities like Power of Change, Energy of Mars, Enthusiasm of Jupiter, Imagination of Moon, Beauty of Venus, Mobility of Mercury, and Ambition of Saturn onto the Wand, culminating in a Banishing Ritual.

A 6-step ritual to consecrate a magical Sword. It involves consecrating a circle, holding the Sword, facing the Watchtower of Air, and invoking the King (BATAIVAH) and Seniors of Air (HABIORO, AAOZAIF, HTNORDA, AHAOZPI, AVTOTAR, HIPOTGA). This bestows qualities like Power of Discernment, Courage of Mars, Wisdom of Jupiter, Instinct of Moon, Harmony of Venus, Intelligence of Mercury, and Preservation of Saturn onto the Sword, culminating in a Banishing Ritual.

A 6-step ritual to consecrate a magical Cup. It involves consecrating a circle, holding the Cup, facing the Watchtower of Water, and invoking the King (RAAGIOSL) and Seniors of Water (LSRAHPM, SAIINOV, LAVAXRP, SLGAIOL, SOAIZNT, LIGDISA). This bestows qualities like Power of Reflection, Passion of Mars, Benevolence of Jupiter, Receptivity of Moon, Love of Venus, Self-Expression Mercury, and Stability of Saturn onto the Cup, culminating in a Banishing Ritual.

A 6-step ritual to consecrate a magical Pantacle. It involves consecrating a circle, holding the Pantacle, facing the Watchtower of Earth, and invoking the King (IKZHIKAL) and Seniors of Earth (LAIDROM, AKZINOR, LZINOPO, ALHKTGA, AHMLLKV, LIIANSA). This bestows qualities like Power of Fruitfulness, Desire of Mars, Generosity of Jupiter, Memory of Moon, Fruitfulness of Venus, Reason of Mercury, and Concentration of Saturn onto the Pantacle, culminating in a Banishing Ritual.

Explains AIQ BKR (Qabalah of Nine Chambers) as a method to reduce large numbers to a single digit (1-9), revealing occult significance. It provides a table of AIQ BKR Reductions, defining each number's meaning (e.g., 1=Unity, 2=Duality, 3=Matter) as applied to Enochian gematric values.

Describes two special postures used in Enochian Magick: 'Rending of the Veil' (forcing oneself through a barrier into another region) and 'Closing of the Veil' (reclosing the barrier). These gestures are crucial for entering and exiting Watchtower Squares or Aethyrs in Spirit Vision.

structure_content.chapter_title: SPIRIT VISION IN THE WATCHTOWERS A Beginner's Method
structure_content.summary: Provides a 7-step beginner's method for developing the Body of Light to skry into Watchtower Squares. It involves preparing a colored card of the desired region, consecrating the area, holding a magical instrument, gazing at the card, mentally expanding the square into a door, passing through, observing, and returning, followed by a banishing ritual and diary entry.

structure_content.chapter_title: SPIRIT VISION IN THE WATCHTOWERS An Advanced Method
structure_content.summary: Outlines a 9-step advanced method for Spirit Vision, assuming prior Body of Light development. It requires memorizing signposts, proper Calls, and Enochian Names of Power for the desired square. The method involves banishing rituals, placing the card, reciting Calls, vibrating names, concentrating on the door, projecting the Body of Light, encountering deities, observing, and returning.

structure_content.chapter_title: A BEGINNER'S EXERCISE FOR SUBTLE BODY DEVELOPMENT
structure_content.summary: Presents a 7-step exercise to develop the subtle body for Spirit Vision, stressing frequency and consistent practice. It involves preparing the self and surroundings, imagining the body as empty, transferring consciousness, moving forward, rising high above earth, returning, and recording experiences, with detailed notes on comfort, prana flow, and consciousness shift.

structure_content.chapter_title: AN ADVANCED EXERCISE-RISING ON THE PLANES
structure_content.summary: Offers a 5-step advanced exercise for rising on the planes, adapted from Crowley's Liber O, for magical preparation. It requires developing a subtle body and aims for Dharana or Samadhi (one-pointed concentration). The exercise involves preparing, projecting the subtle body straight up, continuing to rise, relaxing and sinking back, and recording experiences.

structure_content.chapter_title: RITUAL OUTLINE FOR A JOURNEY TO SQUARE B OF OYVB IN WATER OF AIR
structure_content.summary: Provides a 7-step ritual outline for a Spirit Vision journey to the Water of Air sub-quadrant (OYVB, square B). It includes consecrating a circle, banishing rituals, facing East with a Sword/Dagger, reciting the third and seventh Enochian Calls, vibrating Names of Power (BATAIVAH, HABIORO, AAOZAIF, HTNORDA, AHAOZPI, AVTOTAR, HIPOTGA), entering the Body of Light, observing Water/Air combinations, encountering Isis (Fire of Solidification) and Archangel ABOYV, and returning.

structure_content.chapter_title: RITUAL OUTLINE FOR A JOURNEY TO SQUARE A OF PALI IN FIRE OF FIRE
structure_content.summary: Presents a 10-step ritual outline for a Spirit Vision journey to the Fire of Fire sub-quadrant (PALI, square A). It involves consecrating a circle with MZKZB formula, banishing rituals, facing South with a Wand, reciting the sixth Enochian Call, vibrating Names of Power (OIP-TEAA-PDOKE, EDLPRNAA, AAETPIO, ADAEOET, ALNKVOD, AAPDOKE, ANODOIN, ARINNAP), encountering Bastas and Archangel ALIP, and returning.

structure_content.chapter_title: RITUAL OUTLINE FOR A JOURNEY TO SQUARE L OF RNIL IN FIRE OF WATER
structure_content.summary: Outlines an 11-step ritual for a Spirit Vision journey to the Fire of Water sub-quadrant (RNIL, square L). It involves consecrating a circle with TOOG formula, banishing rituals, facing West with a Cup, reciting the fourth and twelfth Enochian Calls, vibrating Names of Power (RAAGIOSL, LSRAHPM, SAIINOV, LAVAXRP, SLGAIOL, SOAIZNT, LIGDISA), encountering Sothis and Archangel ALRNI, dealing with demon ALR, and returning.

Explains the 30 Aethyrs (Aires) as subtle cosmic planes ordered from TEX (30, lowest) to LIL (1, highest), serving as a powerful structure similar to the Qabalistic Tree of Life. It notes ZAX (10th Aethyr) corresponds to the Abyss and emphasizes serial exploration to master each Aethyr's unique presiding atmosphere and forces.

Connects the Aethyrs to magical grades within self-initiation, similar to Sephiroth in the Golden Dawn. It lists correspondences: TEX (Neophyte), BAG (Theoricus), DES (Practicus), NIA (Philosophus), ASP (Adeptus Minor), ZEN (Adeptos Mayorr Geburah), VTA (Adeptus Exemptus), ZID (Magister Templi), ZOM (Magus), LIL (Ipsissimus), detailing the experiences and abilities associated with each level of attainment.

Discusses sex as a fundamental expression of creative energy and duality within Enochian Magick. It states that Aethyrs below LIL are charged with masculine and feminine forces, and the Great Work involves uniting all dualities, including sexual polarities, within oneself, recognizing male/female psychic components in everyone.

Explores sexual techniques as an option in magical operations, recognizing their inherent power and potential dangers. It emphasizes that sexual currents are present in the Aethyrs and Watchtower Squares, and practitioners will confront their own sexual nature. The text links the phallus to the 'physiological basis of the Oversoul,' viewing sex as a creative, magical act for conscious expression of the Great Work.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE THREE DEGREES OF SEX MAGICK
structure_content.summary: Outlines three degrees of Sex Magick: Karmamudra (lowest, external partner, dangerous), Jnanamudra (middle, mental/internal partner, suitable for sole magicians creating 'partners' from Aethyrs), and Mahamudra (highest, 'Great Symbol,' experienced unity, no partner needed, fully realized in PAZ, achievable after crossing ZAX). Mahamudra is the ultimate goal, with the first two as steps.

Introduces a daily meditation (15-60 minutes) for six months to prepare the subtle body. It involves sitting erect, concentrating on the spinal column, imagining the brain as a yoni and spine as a lingam, generating psychic heat, and visualizing a current of light flowing through the spine. The meditation aims for physical and psychic results, including increased body temperature and prana flow, to prepare for higher Aethyrs.

A specific meditation for male magicians (adaptable for females) as preparation for entering ZIP. It involves consecrating a circle, concentrating on blackness (ZAX/Abyss), imagining rising into a lush garden, visualizing a giant naked maiden (Daughter of Babalon/anima projection), and merging with her body to experience bliss and union, followed by a banishing ritual and diary entry.

structure_content.chapter_title: MAHAMUDRA OUTLINE FOR AN ADVANCED EXERCISE
structure_content.summary: An advanced meditation for entering higher Aethyrs (above NIA) after success with beginner/intermediate exercises. It involves wearing a black robe, holding a magical Sword, entering the mental body, 'cutting off' thoughts, and then observing the continuous flow of thoughts as an external, tranquil observer on the 'peaceful shore' of the mind, aiming for Samadhi.

Introduces twelve major Enochian formulas (KAL, IAO, QAA, KIKA, TOOG, MZKZB, VOVIN, VRELP, IVITDT, NIAKOD, ZTZTZT, ILIATAI) as expressions of natural motion and intelligent forces. Each formula is associated with specific meanings, gematric correspondences, and often a powerful deity, serving as a 'way of living' or an 'attitude toward life.'

Analyzes the Enochian word KAL ('to solidify'), linking its letters and gematric value (314) to the mystery of Babalon and the Beast, the Great Work, and the King of Air. It describes KAL as the 'formula of consciousness acting through proper discrimination,' representing white Magick and the yogi's process of solidifying the inner spirit.

Examines the Enochian word IAO, linking its letters and gematric value (96) to 'the highest work is man,' 'creation of duality,' and 'the way of the Cup.' It represents a passive acceptance of life and karma-less action, combining Temperance/Art and Hierophant to improve karmic burden.

Explores the Enochian word QAA ('the delight in the works of the sun'), linking its gematric values (52, 312) to solar nature, creativity, and stability in change. It reveals hidden meanings through numerical breakdown (52x2=MAL, 52x3=DAMPLOZ, etc.), suggesting that true creation is the magical process of the Hanged Man.

Analyzes the Enochian word KIKA ('mystery'), linking its phrase ('the enduring truth of the changeless circle') and gematric value (666) to divine will, the Beast of the New Testament, and cyclic spiritual development. It emphasizes tempering judgment with experience for true insight.

Examines the Enochian word TOOG, derived from 'an emanation from the dark recesses of the moon,' with gematric values (77/71) linked to the 5th Aethyr LIT, cycles, and the feminine current. It represents lust (creative desire) and motion, connecting to the Egyptian goddess Maati and the dualistic nature of justice and karma.

Explores the Enochian word MZKZB ('iniquities of the past changing to the joy of righteousness'), with gematric values (1746/413/401) linked to Governors of LEA, KHR, and the Archdemon KHORONZON. It represents cyclic spiritual impulse, continuous progress, and the intoxicating effects of truth, addressing special Qabalistic aspects.

Analyzes the Enochian word VOVIN ('dragon'), derived from 'the mighty wings of the eagle that carry you through the Void,' with gematric values (280/1175) linked to Governors of NIA and the Magical Dragon. It embodies justice, love of life, and mobility, representing the individuality balancing duality in life.

Examines the Enochian word VRELP ('strong seer'), derived from 'seeing the orbit of the sun and partaking of the secrets of truth,' with gematric value (197) linked to Governors of VTA. It is the formula for developing psychic abilities and spiritual wealth, representing the individuality balancing lunar and solar forces.

Analyzes the Enochian word IVITDT, derived from 'the burning flames of truth that consume sorrow, sin and death,' with gematric value (212/1130) linked to Governors of OXO and the 'First Flame.' It is a solar formula for purification by fire, expressing the manifestation of polar forces of duality.

Examines the Enochian word NIAKOD ('safe traveling' or 'means of passage'), derived from 'a sword for the cursed Aethyr of fear, darkness and confusion,' with gematric value (450/1275) linked to Governors of ZAX and KHORONZON. It is a mental sword for personal annihilation in ZAX, offering protection proportional to understanding its formula.

Analyzes the Enochian word ZTZTZT, derived from 'the way of love is to sacrifice all into the Cup,' with gematric values (54/36/18) linked to TALHO ('cup') and LOE (12th Aethyr). It is a feminine formula for stability in change, expressing the proper balance between Leo's creativity and Caput Draconis's initiatory awareness.

Explores the Enochian word ILIATAI, derived from 'to tread the highest path of the secret Wisdom is to unite with the god within yourself,' with gematric values (209/836) linked to Governors of NIA and the first Aethyr LIL. It is the most important Enochian formula for the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel, embodying movement, temperance, and initiated consciousness.

structure_content.chapter_title: TEX AND RIL The Lowest Aethyrs
structure_content.summary: Describes TEX (30th) and RII (29th) as the two lowest Aethyrs, located on the Etheric Plane, corresponding to Earth. Conscious entry into these is crucial, as they are normally entered subconsciously (dreams, psychic visions). TEX handles karma, desire, silence, and restrictive forces, while RII deals with karmic burdens, desires for rewards, and awareness of life without a physical body.

Introduces BAG (28th Aethyr) as a realm requiring a 'magical battle' with the presiding Angel LDCIPSP. This confrontation, described as a mirror of one's soul revealing hidden biases and past deeds, is essential for progression to higher Aethyrs without visual distortion. The mind and emotions are the primary weapons in this battle.

Describes ZAA (27th Aethyr), the 'Aethyr of Solitude,' entered after mastering TEX, RII, and BAG. It is located in the highest astral plane, characterized by the almost total absence of everything except oneself, fostering a deep sense of loneliness. The Guide appears as Diana/Hecate or Isis/Nephthys, teaching acceptance of individuality. The Cup is the most effective weapon here.

Explores DES (26th Aethyr), where the limitations of the human mind and ego are confronted. The Governors (POPHAND, NIGRANA, BAZHIIM) are associated with division and perpetuating logic/reason. The ego is seen not as supreme but as a creation of circumstantial events, requiring realization that there is 'much more' beyond it, preparing for ASP.

structure_content.chapter_title: VTI. TheFirst Stage of the Beast
structure_content.summary: Describes VTI (25th Aethyr) as the first stage of 'the Beast,' where unruly and undisciplined consciousness above normal egoic human consciousness is encountered. The Governors (MIRZIND, OBVAORS, RANGLAM) connect the superconscious with normal human consciousness. The Angel of VTI, TAOTZEM, is a reflex of the Holy Guardian Angel, expressing positive psychic forces degraded by labels, demanding purification of lower nature for spiritual growth.

structure_content.chapter_title: N1 A,. Movement Through Time & Space
structure_content.summary: Explains NIA (24th Aethyr) as the 'Aethyr of motion,' where one learns to travel through time and space. The Governors (ORAKAMIR, KHIASALPS, SOAGEEL) are linked to forces of motion. Mastery of NIA is the primary qualification for the Philosophus grade and the first ordeal of the VOVIN/Magical Dragon, signifying a shift in human concepts of time and space.

Describes TOR (23rd Aethyr) as the beginning of the cosmic plane of Air, where symbols of power and generative energy are seen (e.g., Apis bull). The Aethyr teaches the Qabalistic equation 'stability = change' and the infinite energy that charges the atmosphere. The Rose and Cross symbolize extension in space, and the Governors (RONOAMB, ONIZIMP, ZAXANIN) relate to this dynamic equilibrium.

Explores UN (22nd Aethyr), the 'Aethyr of the Void,' marking the first stage of Samadhi. It is a region where form and the formless merge, allowing one to observe the beginning of form downward and the formless upward. The Guide is Pan, who may appear as winged and multicolored. The experience emphasizes immense expanse, minutest details, and can induce rapture, with the 'eye' symbolizing consciousness.

Describes ASP (21st Aethyr), the 'Aethyr of Causation,' as the realm of the Reincarnating Ego. The atmosphere is initially solitary and formless, but gradually reveals the flow of time and destiny. The throned Angel encountered is one's Reincarnating Ego, whose fixed nature (seeing Aethyrs below, not above) guarantees safe return to the physical body. The Aethyr is initiatory, revealing the magician's role in manifestation.

Explores KHR (20th Aethyr), 'the Wheel,' where the entire world appears as a huge rotating wheel, symbolizing the cycles of Samsara, Law, Taro, Heavens, and Life. The Governors (ZILDRON, PARZIBA, TOTOKAN) are linked to an 'enduring cycle.' KHR contains masculine (Jupiter) and feminine (Juno) energies, forming a field of learning and also a place of distortion and deception.

Discusses POP (19th Aethyr) and ZEN (18th Aethyr) as initiatory Aethyrs. POP offers initiation into the feminine current, guided by the Priestess of the Silver Star (Isis), leading to the grade of Magister Templi. ZEN involves initiation into true meanings of crucifixion and sacrifice, guided by a sexually attractive male (Horus), simulating a descent into a 'Vault.' These prepare for crossing ZAX (the Abyss).

Explores TAN (17th Aethyr), 'The Balance,' where karmic forces combine to create an impression of endless struggle for equilibrium. The Guide is the Angel Madimi, who reveals TAN transforms judgment into justice. The Aethyr signifies an initiation into understanding karma as a natural law, where duality (good/evil, right/wrong) keeps one under its bonds, until a higher karmaless state is reached in LIL.

Examines LEA (16th Aethyr), where Crowley's concepts of Babalon and the Beast manifest, symbolizing the Tarot path of Strength/Lust. It's a realm of turmoil and change, representing the anticipation of death and new life. The Guide is the King of the old Aeon, who is replaced by 'the Beast' (the practitioner's unruly, unpredictable consciousness). It's a powerful feminine current leading to the grade of Magister Templi, with seduction and transformation as key themes.

Describes OXO (15th Aethyr) as a realm of intense joy, love of life, and the idea of life as a dance/play. Successful initiations in lower Aethyrs lead to a wonderful experience here. It contains an initiation into the 'Mystery of the Rose and the Cross,' symbolizing the union of masculine and feminine currents, providing an understanding of life's true purpose as a divine dance. Its complementary opposite is VTA.

structure_content.chapter_title: VTA. The City of the Pyramids
structure_content.summary: Explores VTA (14th Aethyr), 'the City of the Pyramids,' also known as the 'Aethyr of semblances.' It's characterized by utter darkness, solemnity, and stern thoughtfulness. Residents appear devoid of emotions and desires, embodying the masculine current. Crowley saw them as 'pyramids of dust,' symbolizing either a Temple of the Spirit or a tomb. Hermes is the Guide, and the Aethyr offers a lesson on the fate of those detached from humanity.

Describes ZIM (13th Aethyr), 'The Garden of NEMO,' accessible to Magister Templi grade or equivalent. It appears as a golden, beautiful garden, representing the 'Hierarchy of Compassion' or 'Great White Brotherhood.' NEMO ('Nameless One') is the Silent Watcher, tending the garden and guiding selected members to help humanity. Three paths emerge for a NEMO: Adherent, Lover, or Hermit.

Explores LOE (12th Aethyr), 'The Cup of Babalon' or Sangreal, sharing characteristics with POP (19th Aethyr) but at a higher order. It has a strong feminine current and offers the 'Mystery of Babalon' initiation, requiring one to shed blood into the Cup to achieve understanding. It is close to the Sephiroth Binah and also contains the 'Black Brothers,' who refuse to share their wisdom, highlighting the distinction between compassion and spiritual selfishness.

Describes IKH (11th Aethyr), 'The Holy City' or 'Aethyr of Tension,' the highest inhabited region below the Abyss. It presents visions of warriors in armor, symbolizing its proximity to the Abyss and overwhelming anticipation. The city represents elaborate defenses against the demon KHORONZON. It is a place of duality and psychic tug-of-war, where one must confront fear before attempting to cross the Abyss.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE INITIATION OF ZAX-CROSSING THE ABYSS
structure_content.summary: Details the crossing of the Great Outer Abyss (10th Aethyr, ZAX), a significant milestone in a magician's life. It emphasizes preparing mentally and physically, using a protected circle, Names of Power, the NIAKOD formula, a black robe, and a Dagger. The Abyss presents chaotic, whirling forms, and confronting the Archdemon KHORONZON requires silence and total identification with one's Magical Personality to avoid being undone by fear.

Introduces the concept of the 'sun-savior' (ARSOE) in Enochian Magick, equating it to Hindu avatars, Buddhist Bodhisattvas, and the Hanged Man of Tarot. SOE ('savior') is the magical formula of the Messiah, derived from 'the highest understanding is within.' The Magick Square of ARSOE (1637) embodies the linking of solar creative forces with man, representing love and karma manifesting in an individual.

Presents GONO ('faith') as the primary Enochian healing formula, linking it to karma and the soul's health. It explains that healing involves understanding karma, accepting or rejecting death, and restoring consciousness to its inner source. The Magick Square of OLAP (318) is an effective talisman for healing mind, soul, and physical body.

Offers three healing rituals: 'Beginner's Healing Ritual' for self-healing (using OLAP talisman, invoking elemental Kings/Angels with specific visualizations), 'Intermediate Healing Ritual' for healing at a distance (establishing a link, visualizing a Vortex of Power), and 'Advanced Healing Meditation' (meditating on OLAP's harmony and transferring it to the body). All emphasize recording results in the Magical Diary.

Connects Enochian Magick to alchemy as a process of transmutation: ignorance to wisdom, sickness to health, and mortality to longevity, via 'magical fire' (Kundalini, Fohat). It describes the body's aura as an electromagnetic field with poles, and outlines an 'Intermediate Meditational Exercise' to visualize Watchtowers within the body and circulate psychic heat.

Explains the use of the thirty Aethyrs to create an 86-card Enochian Tarot deck for divination and meditation. It outlines the specific meanings for each Aethyr card in both upright and reversed positions, suggesting a 13-card layout for readings, where each position corresponds to different influences (e.g., present atmosphere, masculine/feminine influences, outcomes, past/present/future tendencies).

Introduces the thirteen rituals in the manual as syntheses of Enochian Magick's major elements, requiring charged talismans, weapons, and formulas. Emphasizes proper vibration of names, Magical Imagination for Spirit Vision, solitary practice, and prior development of the subtle body and Mahamudra for effective execution.

A beginner's ritual for a Spirit Vision journey to the 30th Aethyr, TEX. It involves wearing a white robe, consecrating a circle, holding a Sword, facing elemental directions (North, East, South, West) to trace sigils (TAOAGLA, GEMNIMB, ADUORPT, DOZIAAL), vibrating Names of Power, and confronting karmic burdens, selfish desires, ignorance, and self-imposed restrictions, followed by release and recording.

A ritual for magicians of all levels, using the formula of IAO to transmute karmic debts. It involves charging talismans (IAO, ZTZTZT, NIAKOD, LAHALASA, ROR, GRAA), wearing a white robe, consecrating a circle, performing Banishing Rituals, raising a weapon while speaking IA.DNAH and ATH, tracing a white cross, rising through Aethyrs (to MAZ with NIAKOD), confronting a 'dark cloud' of Karma (with TALHO), and finally receiving 'Pardon' (with ZTZTZT, ILIATAI, and KNILA SAH TALHO), leading to union of life and death, and ending with banishing rituals.

structure_content.chapter_title: ENOCHIAN RITUAL OF THE PRIESTESS OF THE SILVER STAR
structure_content.summary: An intermediate/experienced magician's ritual simulating initiation in the 19th Aethyr, POP, invoking its strong feminine current. It involves charging various talismans (IAO, QAA, TOOG, ROR, GRAA), wearing a white robe, using Cup/Pantacle/Wand, consecrating a circle, invoking with IAO, ELZAP TALHO, entering Body of Light to a Tree of Life/Desert, holding QAA/ROR talismans for 'Life' and TOOG/GRAA for 'Death,' and addressing Isis, culminating in a banishing ritual.

An experienced magician's ritual simulating initiation in the 18th Aethyr, ZEN, invoking its masculine current. It involves charging talismans (MZKZB, VOVIN, IVITDT, VRELP, ZTZTZT, ILIATAI, AMMA, elemental Watchtowers), wearing a black robe, consecrating a circle, facing Earth Watchtower (with MZKZB) to visualize a stone Pyramid and its opening, descending into a chamber, entering a pool of water (with RAAGIOSL), rising through a shaft into an air chamber (with BATAIVAH), then a fiery red chamber (with EDLPRNAA), speaking various formulas, attaining Samadhi, and returning through each body.

For Enochian Magicians seeking the title of Magical Dragon, based on the VOVIN formula. It involves charging multiple talismans (VOVIN, VRELP, TOOG, NIAKOD, ILIATAI, ZTZTZT, Watchtower Magick Squares, BABALON), wearing a black robe, consecrating a circle, facing each elemental Watchtower (Earth, Water, Air, Fire) while holding tools and vibrating names/formulas, then invoking Mobility (TOOG), Detachment (VRELP), Knowledge (NIAKOD), Understanding (ILIATAI), Compassion (ZTZTZT), and finally the Goddess BABALON and the Dragon VOVIN, concluding with a banishing.

A ritual for safely entering the City of the Pyramids (14th Aethyr, VTA), based on the VRELP formula. It involves wearing a black robe, charging talismans (VRELP, KAL, IVITDT, NEMO, AMMA, ROR), placing a Sword on the Altar, consecrating a circle, vibrating names and tracing sigils of TEDOAND, VIVIPOS, VOANAMB with a Wand, and speaking a magical command to remove pride, karma, and ignorance, culminating in an entry into the 'domain' of VTA.

A ritual for magicians of all levels to produce a magical elixir. It involves wearing a white robe, preparing sixteen Watchtower talismans and wine in a Cup on the Altar, consecrating a circle, then sequentially holding each elemental Watchtower talisman (Earth, Water, Air, Fire, and their sub-elements) high above the Cup, invoking their respective Angels (e.g., NRONK for Earth of Earth), visualizing rays of light entering the wine, and finally drinking the consecrated elixir to instill health and longevity.

An advanced ritual for temporary invisibility. It involves wearing a black robe, consecrating a circle, positioning Watchtower talismans on the Altar, invoking the four Kings of the Watchtowers, and charging the Magical Universe with a Wand while invoking KAOS and KOZMOS. Then, addressing the Governors of PAZ (THOTANF, AXZIARG, OVKHO, POTHNIR) to formulate a 'Shroud of Darkness' as a barrier around the physical body, visualizing it intensifying, practicing invisibility, and finally banishing the Shroud.

structure_content.chapter_title: RITUAL FOR EVOKING THE WATCHTOWER DEITIES
structure_content.summary: A typical evocation ritual for advanced magicians, specifically for the Earth of Earth Angel AXIR. It involves constructing a magick circle with an external triangle for evocation, consecrating the circle, placing a charged AXIR Pantacle on the Altar, opening the ritual by invoking elemental Fire, Water, Air, and Earth with corresponding tools, then invoking the King (IKZHIKAL), Seniors, and Calvary Cross names of Earth, binding the Angel AXIR, and demanding it perform tasks, concluding with a banishing ritual.

An advanced ritual to bring invisible astral objects into physical manifestation. It involves wearing a black robe, consecrating a circle, placing a charged LAHALASA talisman on the Altar, visualizing the object, then sequentially facing elemental Watchtowers (Fire, Air, Water, Earth), concentrating on their central squares, invoking the Kings (OIP-TEAA-PDOKE, OROIBAHAOZPI, MPHARSLGAIOL, MOR-DIAL-HKTGA) and visualizing elemental energy rays entering the object. It culminates in vibrating LAHALASA to condense a cloud into the object, and invoking Governors of TOR (RONOAMB, ONIZIMP, ZAXANIN) for manifestation, without a final banishing ritual.

A ritual for magicians to face and cross the Abyss (10th Aethyr, ZAX). It involves wearing a white robe, placing an Altar with a Sword, NIAKOD talisman, and elemental Watchtower tablets, lighting colored candles, performing a banishing ritual, then invoking each Watchtower (Earth, Water, Air, Fire) while circling tables and vibrating Aethyr names. The magician thrusts their Sword into the darkness of the Abyss, confronts KHORONZON, and proceeds to move through the Aethyrs of the Abyss, ultimately stating their knowledge of form, structure, and suchness, and finally returns.

An advanced ritual designed for magicians to confront and transcend their own death, transforming it into an initiation into life. It involves wearing a black robe, entering the Body of Light, and facing each Watchtower (Earth, Water, Air, Fire) sequentially. While addressing the Kings (IKZHIKAL, RAAGIOSL, BATAIVAH, OIP-TEAA-PDOKE) and specific Enochian names, the magician visualizes leaving their physical body, mind, and personality, embracing 'Great Places of Comfort' and the 'Palace of Our Lady Babalon', and ultimately asserting identity as the 'Lord of Life' and 'Son of Osiris' who triumphs over death, followed by a banishing ritual.

key_concepts.definition: A powerful system for spiritual development, self-initiation, and conscious control over one's self and surroundings, revealed to John Dee and Edward Kelly, and further developed by the Golden Dawn and Aleister Crowley.

Thirty subtle cosmic planes or Aires, arranged serially from lowest (TEX, 30th) to highest (LIL, 1st), representing progressive stages of spiritual journey and initiation, comparable to Qabalistic Sephiroth and Tarot Paths.

Four great elemental cosmic regions (Earth, Water, Air, Fire) each composed of 12x13 squares, connected by a Black Cross and further united by the Tablet of Union. They are multi-dimensional representations of inner planes, populated by hierarchies of deities, demons, astrological signs, and Tarot correspondences.

The practitioner's own spiritual self or genius, a spark of divinity at the core of being, acting on a higher level than the human mind. The Knowledge and Conversation of the HGA is the central and ultimate goal of Enochian Magick, encountered directly in the 8th Aethyr, ZID.

The subtle body (also called astral body, astraldouble, body of fire, body of desire, scin-laeca), used for out-of-body travel and Spirit Vision through the subtle cosmic planes. Its development is essential for performing Enochian operations and requires maintaining full consciousness with unbroken memory.

The system of assigning numerical values to Enochian letters and words, revealing hidden correspondences and relationships. It is used to understand the meaning of Words of Power and can have different schemes (e.g., Aurum Solis, Golden Dawn Greek/Hebrew, Golden Dawn-Geomancy, Crowley's system).

A magical figure or object constructed and charged with specific psychic forces or energies for a particular purpose. It acts as a physical embodiment of an idea or entity, linked to the magician's personal karma and emotional/psychic energies.

A geometric arrangement of letters or numbers used for meditation or as a talisman. In Enochian Magick, each letter in a square represents a force, and their relational positions describe an important part of the magical universe, often losing power if logically defined by the rational mind.

The magical operation of 'calling in' a deity with the intention of assuming its identity, thereby allowing the magician to speak and act with the deity's authority. It typically involves drawing a circle around the practitioner.

The magical operation of 'calling forth' a deity or entity to communicate with it while retaining one's own sense of identity. It typically involves drawing a triangle outside the magician's circle to contain the evoked entity.

A form of out-of-body traveling where the practitioner leaves the physical cosmic plane and travels through subtle cosmic planes in their subtle body, maintaining full consciousness and unbroken memory.

A magical operation involving the use of a shewstone or other appropriate device to focus consciousness on subtle planes while retaining awareness and control of the physical body. It is a form of meditation where the mind roams the Watchtowers and Aethyrs, and visions and voices are encountered.

A natural law or principle that acts on all cosmic planes, seeking to bring equilibrium to polar forces. It implies that good and evil, right and wrong, spirit and matter are interconnected, influencing one's experiences and progress in the magical grades, particularly emphasized in the 17th Aethyr, TAN.

Key archetypes in Aleister Crowley's Magick, representing the feminine current (Babalon, Mother of Abominations) and the masculine current (the Beast, often a bull-like figure), associated with the Tarot path of Strength/Lust and the 16th Aethyr, LEA. Their union symbolizes creative change and spiritual transformation.

The third and highest stage of Sex Magick, meaning 'Great Symbol' or 'great Attitude.' It signifies an 'experienced unity' where the feminine and masculine currents are of equal intensity within oneself, eliminating the need for an external or internal partner, fully realized in the 4th Aethyr, PAZ.

A boundary located at the outer limit of each cosmic plane, prohibiting passage of a lower cosmic element into a higher sphere. In the Aethyrs, it represents barriers that require specific initiations or development (e.g., leaving the astral body to enter TOR, leaving the mental body to cross ZAX).

The philosophical concept that man (microcosm) is a reflection or small-scale replica of the universe (macrocosm), and what is within man has its counterpart in the outer world. This principle underpins the effectiveness of Enochian Magick operations and the ability to control one's surroundings by controlling oneself.

practical_system.description: The practical system of Enochian Magick outlined in this manual focuses on self-initiation and spiritual development through direct experience of the subtle cosmic planes, primarily the 30 Aethyrs and the four elemental Watchtowers. It emphasizes the development of the 'Body of Light' for Spirit Vision (astral travel) and skrying. The system relies on a structured approach to rituals, incorporating Enochian language, gematria, astrological and planetary correspondences, and Egyptian deities. Practitioners are guided to assume a Magical Name, take a Magical Oath, and maintain a Magical Diary to track progress. The ultimate goal is the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel and the union of microcosm and macrocosm.
tools: Talismans (charged figures for formulas, deities, Watchtowers)
rituals: Spirit Vision in the Watchtowers (Beginner's Method)
Spirit Vision in the Watchtowers (Advanced Method)
Beginner's Exercise for Subtle Body Development
Advanced Exercise - Rising on the Planes
Ritual for Journey to B of OYVB Water of Air
Ritual for Journey to A of PALI Fire of Fire
Ritual for Journey to L of RNIL Fire of Water
Ritual for Journey to L of RLMU Water of Earth
Ritual for the Knowledge & Conversation of your Holy Guardian Angel
Enochian Magick Healing Techniques (Beginner's Healing Ritual)
Intermediate Healing Ritual (Healing Others at a Distance)
Enochian Ritual of the Priestess of the Silver Star
Ritual for Evoking the Watchtower Deities

relevant_quotes.text: 'The whole question has been threshed out and organized by wise men of old; they have made a Scince of Life complete and perfect; and they have given to it the name of MAGICK'
"The whole question has been threshed out and organized by wise men of old; they have made a Scince of Life complete and perfect; and they have given to it the name of MAGICK"
"The whole question has been threshed out and organized by wise men of old; they have made a Scince of Life complete and perfect; and they have given to it the name of MAGICK"
Magick is the Science of understanding oneself and one's conditions. It is the Art of applying that under standing in actian.

It may be conceded in any case that the long strings of formidable words which roar and moan through so many conjurations have a real effect in exalting the consciousness of the magician to the proper pitch-that they should do so is no more extraordinary than music of any kind should do so.
'There are only two operations possble in the universe, AnaIysis and Synthesis. To divide, and to unite. Salve et coagula' said the Alchemists."
This manual is meant to provide a convenient and reasonably complete source of all information required by the serious practitioner of Enochian Magick.
The Hermetic axiom, "as aboye so below," is used in Enochian Magick to explain how each cosmic plane can be divided into subplanes.

"It (Le., Enochian is not a jargon; it has a grammar and syntax of its own. It is very much more sonorous, stately and impressive than even Greek or Sanskrit, and the English translation, though in places difficult to understand, contains passages of a sustained subIimity that Shakespeare, Milton and the Bble do not surpass."
"Every man and every woman is a star."
Let there be no difference made among you between any one thing and any other thing for thereby there cometh hurt.
Regardless of their origin, these Tablets and the whole Enochian system do represent realities of the inner planes. Their value is undoubted, as only a little study and application prove.

The Enochian Tablets are four in number, each referred to one of the elements of Earth, Air, Fire and Water. In addition to these four there is another smaller Tablet, which is called The Tablet of Union, referred to the element of Ether or Spirit. Its function, as its name implies, is a unite and bnd together the four elemental Tablets.
I must now explain the real meaning of the terms Sephira and Sephiroth. The first is singular, the second is plural. The best rendering of the word is "numerical emanation."
And the Angel sayeth: Verily is the Pyramid a Temple of Initiation. Verily also is it a tomb.

The most important tem on each Angelic Tablet is the Great Cross whose shaft descends from top to bottom and whose bar crosses the Tablet in the centre. This Cross comprises 36 squares, and has a double vertical line which is called linea Dei Patris Fitiique,'the Line of God the Father and the Son, and 'Linea Spiritus Sancti,' the Line of the Holy Spirit, crossing this horizontally, and containing one rank of letters.
A talisman is a storehouse of some particular kind of energy, the kind that is needed to accomplish the task for which you have constructed it.
The Hexagram, symbol of the Macrocosm and Microcosm interlaced, and hence of the End of the Great Work.
The Pentagram, symbol of the squaring of the circle by virtue of ALHIM =3.1415, symbol of man's will, of the evil 4 dominated by manis spirit
The two lowest Aethyrs are TEX, the 30th Aethyr, and Rll, the 29th TEX is "the Aethyr that is in four parts" but actually Rh is usually divided into four parts as well.
The 25th Aethyr, VTI, is the region of the first stage of what Crowley called the Beast.
The 24th Aethyr, NIA, is the Aethyr of motion. In NIA you will learn to travel through both time and space.
The 23rd Aethyr, TOR. Also, as a preparation for TOR, you are advised to carefully study the formula of KAL.
The 22nd Aethyr, UN. This is the Aethyr of the Void. UN marks the first stage in the mystical state called Samadhi.

The 21st Aethyr is the Aethyr of Causation, ASP. The word ASP has the number 22, which is also the number for T-SA which means "the likeness within" and the number of paths on the Tree of Life. This the Aethyr of the Reincarnating Ego.
The 20th Aethyr, KHR, you will see the entire world as a huge rotating wheel.

Many of the Aethyrs contain initiations, or require initiation before you can safely enter. You do not need to join a club or society in order to achieve such initiations, although they could be helpful to you.
After the initiations in POP and ZEN you will be ready to view the Karmic Balance that lies in the 17th Aethyr, TAN.
The primary feeling throughout the 15th Aethyr, OXO, is intense joy.
The Aethyr called VTA by the Golden Dawn and UTI or VTI by Crowley contains the City of the Pyramids.
After a successful initiation in the City of the Pyramids, you are now ready to see the Garden of NEMO which lies in the 13th Aethyr, ZIM.
The Cup of Babalon, the Sangreal, can be seen in the 12th Aethyr, LOE.
The Holy City is the name given to the highest inhabited region below the Abyss. It is located in the eleventh Aethyr, IKH, and you will see it whenever you enter this Aethyr.
One of the most significant milestones in the life of a magician is the crossing of the Great Outer Abyss. Enochian Magick reserves the 10th Aethyr for the Abyss which is called ZAX.
This invocation, the Knowledge and Conversation of your Holy Guardian Angel, is the primary goal of Enochian Magick.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book provides an advanced, practical guide to Enochian Magick, contextualizing it within the Western Esoteric tradition, particularly drawing from the works of John Dee, the Golden Dawn, and Aleister Crowley. It demystifies complex concepts like the Aethyrs and Watchtowers, offering structured methods for spiritual development and self-initiation, which remains highly relevant for solitary practitioners. The emphasis on conscious control, self-awareness, and the integration of internal (microcosm) and external (macrocosm) realities aligns with modern magical theory. By outlining clear rituals, formulas, and correspondences, the text empowers individuals to engage deeply with a powerful, often guarded, system of Magick.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The book is intended for serious practitioners of Enochian Magick, ranging from beginners to advanced magicians. It explicitly states that it assumes the reader is familiar with the basic concepts from its companion book, 'Enochian Magic: A Practical Manual.' It targets those interested in self-initiation, spiritual development, and gaining conscious control over their lives, appealing to individuals who prefer solitary practice over traditional group ceremonies. It also caters to students of Western Esotericism who seek a deep, technical understanding of Enochian systems and their practical applications, including gematria, astrological correspondences, and the use of magical tools.
